scsf
  • Reference
  • Articles
  • News

Coordinate decomposition

Collect all coordinates in one table, the path_link_vertex table has the information about the original grouping.

# S3 method for sf
sc_coord(x, ...)

# S3 method for sfc
sc_coord(x, ...)

# S3 method for MULTIPOLYGON
sc_coord(x, ...)

# S3 method for POLYGON
sc_coord(x, ...)

# S3 method for MULTILINESTRING
sc_coord(x, ...)

# S3 method for LINESTRING
sc_coord(x, ...)

# S3 method for MULTIPOINT
sc_coord(x, ...)

# S3 method for POINT
sc_coord(x, ...)

Arguments

x
input `simple features` `sf` object
...
arguments passed to methods

See also

`sc_path` for the central part of the model, `sc_object` for the features, and `PATH` for the full model.

Examples

data("sfzoo")
sc_coord(sf::st_sfc(sfzoo))
#> # A tibble: 55 × 2
#>       x_    y_
#>    <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1    1.0   2.0
#> 2    3.2   4.0
#> 3    3.0   4.6
#> 4    3.8   4.4
#> 5    3.5   3.8
#> 6    3.4   3.6
#> 7    3.9   4.5
#> 8    0.0   3.0
#> 9    0.0   4.0
#> 10   1.0   5.0
#> # ... with 45 more rows
lapply(sfzoo, sc_coord)
#> $point
#> # A tibble: 1 × 2
#>      x_    y_
#>   <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1     2
#> 
#> $multipoint
#> # A tibble: 6 × 2
#>      x_    y_
#>   <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1   3.2   4.0
#> 2   3.0   4.6
#> 3   3.8   4.4
#> 4   3.5   3.8
#> 5   3.4   3.6
#> 6   3.9   4.5
#> 
#> $linestring
#> # A tibble: 4 × 2
#>      x_    y_
#>   <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     0     3
#> 2     0     4
#> 3     1     5
#> 4     2     5
#> 
#> $multilinestring
#> # A tibble: 10 × 2
#>       x_    y_
#>    <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1    0.0   3.0
#> 2    0.0   4.0
#> 3    1.0   5.0
#> 4    2.0   5.0
#> 5    0.2   3.0
#> 6    0.2   4.0
#> 7    1.0   4.8
#> 8    2.0   4.8
#> 9    0.0   4.4
#> 10   0.6   5.0
#> 
#> $polygon
#> # A tibble: 10 × 2
#>       x_    y_
#>    <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1      0     0
#> 2      1     0
#> 3      3     2
#> 4      2     4
#> 5      1     4
#> 6      0     0
#> 7      1     1
#> 8      1     2
#> 9      2     2
#> 10     1     1
#> 
#> $multipolygon
#> # A tibble: 24 × 2
#>       x_    y_
#>    <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1      0     0
#> 2      1     0
#> 3      3     2
#> 4      2     4
#> 5      1     4
#> 6      0     0
#> 7      1     1
#> 8      1     2
#> 9      2     2
#> 10     1     1
#> # ... with 14 more rows
#> 
sc_coord(sf::st_sfc(sfzoo))
#> # A tibble: 55 × 2
#>       x_    y_
#>    <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1    1.0   2.0
#> 2    3.2   4.0
#> 3    3.0   4.6
#> 4    3.8   4.4
#> 5    3.5   3.8
#> 6    3.4   3.6
#> 7    3.9   4.5
#> 8    0.0   3.0
#> 9    0.0   4.0
#> 10   1.0   5.0
#> # ... with 45 more rows
